title: How should I write an essay about the description of a place? - Quora

response.answer_text: Prepare a list of the key characteristics of the place: purpose, age, size, building material, access, vegetation, color, decorations, entrance design, windows if any, etc. Write a statement at the beginning that summarizes the key characteristics and the effect it creates on you or others. Write a paragraph for each key characteristic, but start with a topic sentence for that characteristic, such as “the vegetation surrounding the church is dense.” Then proceed to explain in detail about the key characteristic, in this case the vegetation, such as “the building is surrounded by large junipers.”

The great visualization abilities assist in it. If you develop your visual memory and attention, you become able to remember all the details of what you saw. If you are to write en essay about an imaginative place, give way to your fantasy, you may see in your own place any object you want. An alternative solution would be asking SupremeEssays requesting the help of professional writers specializing in descriptive essays.

Since the essay must be factual, get as much research information as you can about the place in question. To start with, people want to know how old the place is, where it was built, and how it was built. Then you want to describe what it's made of, is it Stone, is it made of wood, or is it native Steel? Then, you will want to tell them what the building was used for. Was it religious? Is it a burial place?
The elements for a description of a place are the following: a. geography b. size or dimension c. distance e. spatial relationships (above, below, next to, etc.)
